name: Peanut Allergy
description: An allergy to peanuts, a common food allergen. Reactions can be severe and life-threatening.
sideEffects: Swelling of the lips, face, tongue, or throat

name: Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis
description: Also known as hay fever, this is an allergic reaction to pollen from trees, grasses, or weeds.

name: Penicillin Allergy
description: An allergic reaction to the antibiotic penicillin. This is one of the most common drug allergies.

name: Latex Allergy
description: An allergy to natural rubber latex, often found in medical gloves, balloons, and other products.

name: Dust Mite Allergy
description: An allergy to tiny bugs called dust mites, which live in house dust. This can trigger asthma symptoms.

name: Egg Allergy
description: An immune system reaction to proteins in eggs. It is one of the most common food allergies in children.

name: Cat Dander Allergy
description: An allergic reaction to proteins found in a cat's skin flakes, saliva, and urine. Symptoms can persist long after the cat is gone.
sideEffects: Asthma symptoms like coughing and wheezing

name: Nickel Allergy
description: A common cause of allergic contact dermatitis. It occurs when the skin comes into contact with items containing nickel, such as jewelry or belt buckles.
sideEffects: Rash or bumps on the skin
Dry patches of skin that may resemble a burn
Blisters and fluid drainage in severe cases

name: Insect Sting Allergy
description: An allergic reaction to venom from insects like bees, wasps, hornets, or fire ants. Reactions can range from minor to severe.
sideEffects: Large area of swelling around the sting site
Hives or itching over a large area
Dizziness or drop in blood pressure

name: Soy Allergy
description: An allergy to soybeans and soy products. It's often seen in infants and young children and can be outgrown.
